Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Autobiographic \Au`to*bi`o*graph"ic\, Autobiographical \Au`to*bi`o*graph"ic*al\, a. Pertaining to, or containing, autobiography; as, an autobiographical sketch. ``Such traits of the autobiographic sort.'' --Carlyle. -- {Au`to*bi`o*graph"ic*al*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

autobiographical adj 1: of or relating to or characteristic of an autobiographer; "he seldom suppressed his autobiographical tendencies" [syn: {autobiographic}] 2: relating to or in the style of an autobiography; "they compiled an autobiographical history of the movement" [syn: {autobiographic}]
